Class SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation

org.ironmaple.simulation.drivesims.SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem, org.dyn4j.collision.CollisionBody<org.dyn4j.dynamics.BodyFixture>, org.dyn4j.DataContainer, org.dyn4j.dynamics.PhysicsBody, org.dyn4j.geometry.Rotatable, org.dyn4j.geometry.Shiftable, org.dyn4j.geometry.Transformable, org.dyn4j.geometry.Translatable, org.dyn4j.Ownable, HolonomicDriveSubsystem
public class SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation extends AbstractDriveTrainSimulation implements HolonomicDriveSubsystem

Simulates a Simplified Holonomic Drivetrain.

This class simulates a simplified holonomic drivetrain with collision space, allowing the drivetrain to drive on the field.

It is suitable for simulating AI cycle bots or opponent defense bots.

However, this drivetrain simulation is simplified and not entirely realisticâ€”while it accelerates smoothly, the kinematics are not fully accurate.

For a more realistic simulation of your robot's drivetrain, use SwerveDriveSimulation instead.

  • Constructor Details

    • SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation

      public SimplifiedHolonomicDriveSimulation(AbstractDriveTrainSimulation.DriveTrainSimulationProfile profile, edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d initialPoseOnField)

      Creates a Simplified Holonomic Drivetrain Simulation.

      Parameters:
      profile - the profile containing all the configuration settings for the drivetrain, see AbstractDriveTrainSimulation.DriveTrainSimulationProfile
      initialPoseOnField - the initial pose of the drivetrain in the simulation world

  • Method Details

    • getPose

      public edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d getPose()

      Obtains the Position Estimated by the Odometry of This Simulated Chassis.

      This method is used to enable AI opponent robots to follow cycle paths using Path-Planner.

      In this simplified simulation, odometry error is ignored, so the actual pose of the drivetrain is returned.

      Specified by:
      getPose in interface HolonomicDriveSubsystem
      Returns:
      the real pose of the drivetrain.

    • runRawChassisSpeeds

      public void runRawChassisSpeeds(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.ChassisSpeeds speeds)

      Runs Chassis Speeds on This Simulated Chassis.

      This method sets the DESIRED robot-relative chassis speeds on the simulated drivetrain.

      Propelling forces will be applied to the chassis to help it accelerate smoothly to the desired speeds.

      This method is different from AbstractDriveTrainSimulation.setRobotSpeeds(ChassisSpeeds), which jumps to the speed Instantaneously.

      Specified by:
      runRawChassisSpeeds in interface HolonomicDriveSubsystem
      Parameters:
      speeds - the desired robot-relative speeds, represented as ChassisSpeeds

    • simulationSubTick

      public void simulationSubTick()

      Update this chassis simulation.

      Specified by:
      simulationSubTick in class AbstractDriveTrainSimulation

    • setPose

      @Deprecated public void setPose(edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d currentPose)
      Deprecated.

      Setting the Odometry Pose Is Not Supported for This Simplified Holonomic Drive Simulation.

      The method executes nothing.

      You cannot set the odometry pose since the odometry is always correct in this simulation.

      Specified by:
      setPose in interface HolonomicDriveSubsystem
      Parameters:
      currentPose - the new pose yielding where the robot actually is
